channel.title: Can't connect to APT in Qubes-Debian after following kicksecure installation instructions
channel.description:
I followed the exact instructions on this page:
https:// www.whonix .org/wiki/Kicksecure/Debia n
Including the final APT command : sudo mv /etc/apt/sources.list ~/
Now, my machines say kicksecure is enabled but I am unable to access repositories to install or update. What more, I cloned my primary Debian template to see if the problem persists, but it says that `/etc/apt/sources.list` (the original APT configuration file) does not exist.
Urgent help would be greatly appreciated. One note is I did go into the new configuration file and onionize the repositories, but after that didn't work I reverted to the original https:// settings.
Thank you.

item.title: Can't connect to APT in Qubes-Debian after following kicksecure installation instructions
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The smaller issue:

Create empty /etc/apt/sources.list to work around bug.

sudo touch /etc/apt/sources.list

The bigger issue: no fix may be available.

Page https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kicksecure/Debian does not claim to be compatible with Qubes yet.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to APT in Qubes-Debian after following kicksecure installation instructions
